main_description: Multimedia journalist based in New York. I focus my work on exploring the relationship between journalism and technology, always seeking new narratives and formats to tell a story.
about_me:
I am studying a master's degree in Social Journalism with a scholarship from the City University of New York (CUNY) and I was one of the scholarships winners in 2021 by the Association of Foreign Press Correspondents in the United States.

I work as Deputy Editor in Spanish for the Global Investigative Journalism Network (GIJN), where I am in charge of promoting investigative and data journalism in the region, as well as generating and disseminating growth opportunities for Spanish-speaking journalists.

I also belong to the digital team of La Tercera, a news outlet in Chile, in charge of developing new digital journalism products, growing the subscriber program and collaborating as a reporter.

In the course of my professional career I have published works related to health and migration issues in Efecto Cocuyo (Venezuela), Cinco 8, Distintas Latitudes, Caracas Chronicles, La Tercera (Chile) and Salud con Lupa.
newsletter_description: As a personal project, I write a newsletter in which I recommend articles and journalistic tools, share readings and tell a little about living in New York. It is sent every two weeks and you can subscribe here.
